Content: 2*p58396a0228* section aanswer all questions.for questions 1–10, in section a, select one answer from a to d and put a cross in the box . if you change your mind, put a line through the box  and then mark your new answer with a cross .1 recent measurements indicate that the value of the hubble constant is greater than previously estimated. which of the following statements could be a consequence of this?  a the universe might be bigger than we thought.  b the universe might not be as big as we thought.  c the universe might be older than we thought.  d the universe might not be as old as we thought.(total for question 1 = 1 mark)2 it is claimed on a website that the conditions in the core of a star are perfect for fusion. which of the following statements about the interior of a star best supports this claim?  a the density is very high and the temperature is moderate.  b the density is moderate and the temperature is very high.  c the density and temperature are both very high.  d the density and temperature are both moderate.(total for question 2 = 1 mark)

3*p58396a0328*turn over     3 a star is moving towards the earth with a velocity of 1.2 u 106 m sí.  light of wavelength 780 nm is emitted from the star. what would be the wavelength of the light, in nm, recorded by an observer on the earth?  a 780 + 1 2300.⎛⎝⎜⎞⎠⎟ u 780  b 780 + 3001 2.⎛⎝⎜⎞⎠⎟ u 780  c í1 2300.⎛⎝⎜⎞⎠⎟ u 780  d í 3001 2.⎛⎝⎜⎞⎠⎟ u 780(total for question 3 = 1 mark)4 a student used a geiger-müller tube and counter to measure the count near to a radioactive source for one minute.  he used this value to calculate the count rate due to the source in bq. which of the following would decrease the percentage uncertainty in the student’s value for the activity?  a add the background count to the measured count.  b increase the counting time to 10 minutes.  c increase the distance of the geiger-müller tube from the source.  d subtract the background count from the calculated count rate.(total for question 4 = 1 mark)

4*p58396a0428* 5 a mass was hung from the end of spring 1 and set into vertical oscillation.  another mass was hung from the end of spring 2 and also set into vertical oscillation. the maximum velocity, angular frequency and amplitude of the mass on each spring are summarised in the table below.spring 1spring 2maximum velocityv1v2angular frequencyȧ2ȧamplitudeaa / 2 which of the following statements about the maximum velocities is correct?  a v1 = v24  b v1 = v22  c v1 = v2  d v1 = 2v2(total for question 5 = 1 mark)6 a pendulum is driven into oscillation and resonance occurs. what happens to the maximum damping force as the amplitude of oscillation increases?  a the maximum damping force gradually decreases.  b the maximum damping force gradually increases.  c the maximum damping force increases and then decreases.  d the maximum damping force stays constant. (total for question 6 = 1 mark)7 the temperature of a fixed volume of an ideal gas is increased from 300 k to 330 k. which of the following statements is not true?  a the internal energy of the gas increases by 10%.  b the kinetic energy of the molecules in the gas increases by 10%.  c the potential energy of the molecules in the gas increases by 10%.  d the value of ¢c2² for the molecules in the gas increases by 10%.(total for question 7 = 1 mark)

5*p58396a0528*turn over     8 a fixed mass of an ideal gas exerts a pressure p.  the volume occupied by the gas is doubled, and the absolute temperature of the gas is halved. what is the new pressure exerted by the gas?  a 0.25 p  b 0.5 p  c 2 p  d 4 p(total for question 8 = 1 mark)9 star x has a luminosity l and is a distance x from the earth.  the radiation flux received from this star is f. star y has a luminosity 3l and is a distance 2x from the earth. what is the radiation flux received from star y?  a 3f/4  b 2f/3  c 4f/3  d 3f/2(total for question 9 = 1 mark)

8*p58396a0828* 12 a coffee is made with hot water and milk. (a) the water used to make the coffee is heated to its boiling point.  describe the changes in the internal energy of the water while it is boiling.(2) (b) a cup contains 45 g of coffee at a temperature of 73.5 °c.  milk at a temperature of 62.0 °c is added to the coffee.  the temperature of the mixture immediately after adding the milk is 65.5 °c.  calculate the mass of milk that was added to the coffee.  specific heat capacity of coffee = 4200 j kgí kí  specific heat capacity of milk = 3900 j kgí kí(3)mass of milk = (total for question 12 = 5 marks)

(a) mercury takes 7.60 u 106 s to make one complete orbit about the sun.  calculate the radius of this orbit.  you may assume that the orbit is circular.  mass of sun = 1.99 u 1030 kg(3)radius of orbit =

13*p58396a01328*turn over     15  *(a) observation of the night sky, over time, shows changes in the positions of some of the stars.  the diagram below represents a group of stars in a particular field of view over a period of one year.january 2018january 2019july 2018  explain the differences in the field of view over the period january 2018 to january 2019.(4)

14*p58396a01428*  (b) to measure the distances to nearby galaxies, astronomers use stars known as standard candles within those galaxies.  describe how standard candles can be used to determine distances to galaxies.(3)(total for question 15 = 7 marks)

15*p58396a01528*turn over     16 the photograph shows a musical box mechanism.steel stripspins on rotating cylinder as the cylinder rotates, sound is created when pins on the cylinder strike the steel strips.  one end of each strip is fixed and the other end is set into oscillation.  each strip oscillates with simple harmonic motion at a different frequency.  (a) state the condition for an oscillation to be simple harmonic.(2) (b) the end of one steel strip moves through 3.0 mm from one extreme position to the other extreme position, and makes 1600 complete oscillations in 5.0 s.  calculate the maximum acceleration of this end of the steel strip.(3)maximum acceleration =

16*p58396a01628*  (c) the sound made by the musical box mechanism is quiet, but it is observed that when the mechanism is placed on a wooden table there is a large increase in the loudness of the sound.  explain this observation.(3)(total for question 16 = 8 marks)

17*p58396a01728*turn over     17 the hertzsprung-russell (hr) diagram shows how the luminosity l depends on the temperature t for a range of stars.  *(a) the hr diagrams below show star clusters at different stages of evolution.ltltlt x y z  describe how the age of a star cluster can be determined from its hr diagram.   you should refer to each diagram in your answer.(5)

18*p58396a01828*  (b) betelgeuse and rigel a are two of the brightest stars in the night sky.  although both stars have about the same luminosity, rigel a has a much higher surface temperature than betelgeuse.  explain how this information can be used to determine the relative sizes of the two stars.(3)(total for question 17 = 8 marks)

19*p58396a01928*turn over     18 tyres for racing bicycles are often filled with nitrogen gas rather than air.  the tyres are inflated using small cylinders filled with nitrogen gas at high pressure.  the photograph shows such a cylinder.  (a) the cylinder has a volume of 7.25 u 10í m3 and contains 6.85 u 1022 molecules of nitrogen gas.  the temperature of the nitrogen gas is 22.0 °c.  (i) show that the pressure exerted by the nitrogen gas in the cylinder is about 3.9 u 106 pa. (3)  (ii) nitrogen gas at a temperature of 22.0 °c is used to fill a bicycle tyre of volume 1.17 u 10í m3.    show that 3 gas cylinders contain the amount of nitrogen gas needed to fill the tyre to a pressure of 6.55 u 105 pa. (2)

20*p58396a02028*   (iii) in practice, more than 3 cylinders of nitrogen gas may be needed to fill the tyre to a pressure of 6.55 u 105 pa.   suggest a reason why.(1) (b) when the bicycle is in use, the pressure in the tyre falls more slowly if nitrogen gas is used to fill the tyres instead of air.  air is a mixture of mostly nitrogen and oxygen.  nitrogen molecules are larger than oxygen molecules.  suggest why the pressure in the tyre falls more slowly with nitrogen gas.(2)(total for question 18 = 8 marks)
